channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Starship's 10th flight breaks streak of bad luck
item.description: After a series of failures during recent test flights, SpaceX's massive Starship had a smooth ride for Tuesday's blast-off, and successfully deployed some fake satellites.
item.content:encoded:
After a series of failures during recent test flights, SpaceX's massive Starship had a smooth ride for Tuesday's blast-off, and successfully deployed some fake satellites.

(Image credit: Eric Gay)
item.dc:creator: Nell Greenfieldboyce

item.title: A haboob covered central Arizona in dust. But what exactly is it?
item.description: According to the National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration, these storms can whip up walls of dust as high as 10,000 feet.
item.content:encoded:
According to the National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration, these storms can whip up walls of dust as high as 10,000 feet.

(Image credit: Ross D. Franklin)
item.dc:creator: Juliana Kim

item.title: Texas company pleads guilty to 2021 construction worker trench death
item.description: An investigation by NPR, Texas Public Radio and 1A in 2024 found that more than 250 workers had died as a result of preventable trench collapses since 2013, and that at-fault companies were rarely held accountable.
item.content:encoded:
An investigation by NPR, Texas Public Radio and 1A in 2024 found that more than 250 workers had died as a result of preventable trench collapses since 2013, and that at-fault companies were rarely held accountable.

(Image credit: Lorianne Willett)
item.dc:creator: Josh Peck

item.title: Hear New Orleans' rising temperatures in music
item.description: Average temperatures have been going up in many cities, including New Orleans. Here's what those higher temperatures sound like.
item.content:encoded: Average temperatures have been going up in many cities, including New Orleans. Here's what those higher temperatures sound like.
item.dc:creator: Drew Hawkins

item.title: NEA cancels decades-long creative writing fellowship
item.description: For decades the program has supported writers who would become big names – Alice Walker, Michael Cunningham, Louise Erdrich and more. Last week, applicants got an email saying the program would be no more.
item.content:encoded: For decades the program has supported writers who would become big names – Alice Walker, Michael Cunningham, Louise Erdrich and more. Last week, applicants got an email saying the program would be no more.
item.dc:creator: Andrew Limbong

item.title: Taylor Swift and Travis Kelce are in their engagement era
item.description: The singer-songwriter announced the engagement Tuesday on Instagram, with the caption: "Your English teacher and your gym teacher are getting married."
item.content:encoded:
The singer-songwriter announced the engagement Tuesday on Instagram, with the caption: "Your English teacher and your gym teacher are getting married."

(Image credit: Ashley Landis)
item.dc:creator: Juliana Kim

item.title: AI 'deadbots' are persuasive — and researchers say, they're primed for monetization
item.description: The digital afterlife industry may near $80 billion in a decade, fueled by AI "deadbots." Tech firms see profit. But experts warn of troubling consequences.
item.content:encoded:
The digital afterlife industry may near $80 billion in a decade, fueled by AI "deadbots." Tech firms see profit. But experts warn of troubling consequences.

(Image credit: YouTube)
item.dc:creator: Chloe Veltman

item.title: Whistleblower says Trump officials copied millions of Social Security numbers
item.description: A whistleblower complaint says the personal data of over 300 million Americans was copied to a private cloud account to allow access by former members of the Department of Government Efficiency team.
item.content:encoded:
A whistleblower complaint says the personal data of over 300 million Americans was copied to a private cloud account to allow access by former members of the Department of Government Efficiency team.

(Image credit: Wesley Lapointe)
item.dc:creator: Geoff Brumfiel

item.title: DNC chair says he's tired of Democrats bringing 'pencil to a knife fight'
item.description: Day 1 of the Democratic National Committee's summer meeting saw party chair Ken Martin detail how the party is pushing back on Trump administration policies and trying to win back voters.
item.content:encoded:
Day 1 of the Democratic National Committee's summer meeting saw party chair Ken Martin detail how the party is pushing back on Trump administration policies and trying to win back voters.

(Image credit: Sarah Reingewirtz)
item.dc:creator: Stephen Fowler

item.title: The DOJ sued the federal district bench in Maryland. A judge just dismissed the case
item.description: A district judge in Virginia was specially tapped to oversee the unusual case after DOJ named all 15 federal district court judges in Maryland as defendants in a lawsuit related to deportations.
item.content:encoded:
A district judge in Virginia was specially tapped to oversee the unusual case after DOJ named all 15 federal district court judges in Maryland as defendants in a lawsuit related to deportations.

(Image credit: Michael M. Santiago)
item.dc:creator: Carrie Johnson
